subject: Azure Functions Backend Ready for PROD - ENV VAR Change Required
body:
Hi Sarah!

The Azure Functions backend (calendar-be-af) has passed 1:1 parity testing and is ready for PROD deployment.

## What's Changing
The frontend needs to switch from Express BE to Azure Functions BE.

## What You Need To Do
Update the environment variable:
- **Variable**: `NEXT_PUBLIC_BE_URL`
- **Current Value**: Express BE URL (e.g., `https://calendarbe.tangotiempo.com` or similar)
- **New Value**: `https://calendarbeaf.azurewebsites.net` (PROD AF URL)

## Environments
- **TEST AF**: `https://calendarbeaf-test.azurewebsites.net` (already running)
- **PROD AF**: `https://calendarbeaf.azurewebsites.net` (ready for cutover)

## Parity Report
Full parity report available at: `calendar-be-af/.ybotbot/parity-report-2025-12-04.md`

## Key Findings
- All GET endpoints verified 1:1 compatible
- Response wrapper names identical (events, categories, venues, organizers, roles)
- Pagination structure identical
- No breaking changes
- AF adds `timestamp` field (non-breaking)

## Rollback Plan
If any issues, simply revert `NEXT_PUBLIC_BE_URL` back to Express BE URL.

## Testing Recommendation
You may want to test with staging FE pointing to AF TEST first before PROD cutover.

Let me know if you have any questions!

- Fulton
